Hi, I’m Alex!

I build compelling digital products and help SaaS companies grow, I teach and I maintain a couple of projects for fun and profit.

In Montreal, I co-organize product events (Product Circle, Product Tank) and have a podcast on digital product development (on hiatus), prod.

I obssess about user wants and needs and how to the best possibly fulfill them. Happily, I found that understanding customers tends to help products succeed and grow.

If that is what you are looking for, you can learn more about my services below, or just get in touch.

PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT

PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT

A customer is more likley to trust services that looks good and works well. Depending on your need, I can help with either, or both.

DESIGN

Design is not how something looks, but how it works.

This means knowing who you are targeting, what these users want and how you expect them to get value out of your product; and then creating it.

To that end, I can help clarify who the product is targeting, what they are trying to accomplish, map out the core flows of an app, create high levels mockups and refine the experience until we find a minimum lovable product.

WHAT YOU GET

Product requirement document
Distill the product features, functionality and purpose in a single document
User flows
Map the paths taken by users to achieve a successful outcome in your app. For example, launching a campaign.
Mock ups
Design a simplified version of your app in order to identify it's core components and understand how they related to one another.
Components
Catalogue all UI elements that will be used to build interfaces, such as tables, buttons, cards, etc, with their code.
Proto-personas
Create high-level descriptions of target users with their goals and pain points
Jobs map
Group “Jobs-to-be-done” for which your customers “hire” your product

DEVELOPMENT

Development is quite straightforward: I build your app.

But, before starting to code, I like to lay a good foundation by defining the product requirements, the data model and the app’s major components. I also follow continuous deployment best practices and document decisions as I go to the best of my abilities.

As a result, in addition to the code and app, you get documents that allow you continue to build and grow your product.

WHAT YOU GET

Product backlog
Document the work that needs to be done to create and grow the product
Components
Catalogue all UI elements that will be used to build interfaces, such as tables, buttons, cards, etc, with their code.
Schema
Map all tables in a database and the relationship between them.

PRODUCT GROWTH

PRODUCT GROWTH

Growing is hard. You plan campaigns, create marketing material and spend money to get people to your website. Yet, results don’t follow.

That’s normal: reaching customers is hard, knowing what people really want or why they really buy is hard, tracking everything properly is hard.

When trying to grow a product, I help first by clarifying what people buy and why, by structuring your marketing activities so you can test, learn, optimize and by tracking your results accurately so you can make decisions confidently.

CLARIFY

The answer to “Do you know what your customers are buying?” may seem obvious at first… they are buying your product! Yet, customers buy things for many different reasons:

  • They might have a lot of disposable income and can afford to test products,
  • They might have a specific problem they are trying to solve,
  • They might want to look good or know what the fuss is all about.

So, in order to grow, you need to know which customer segment is most important, how do you want to pursue them as well as lay out an overall acquisition and retention strategy for all your prospective users.

WHAT YOU GET

Digital strategy
High-level outline of how and where customers should be reached
Content strategy
Outline how to communicate with customers, using which channels, types of content as well as the expected results
Proto-personas
Create high-level descriptions of target users with their goals and pain points
Jobs map
Group “Jobs-to-be-done” for which your customers “hire” your product

STRUCTURE

Structure is about connecting the what to the how. Once you know who you want to reach and where, in order to improve, you will need to keep track of what was a campaign’s expected outcome and what to do if it fails.

I help by establishing the steps that need to be carried out when planning a growth activity, by documenting growth activities and by carrying out campaigns with internal teams.

WHAT YOU GET

Product marketing roadmap
Outline the main marketing activities for the coming months as well as their intended outcome
Campaign briefs
Summarize the target, objectives, dependencies as well as the objectives of a campaign or activity
Campaign post-mortems
Review campaign performance and formulate next steps

TRACK

Everyone claims to be data-driven. Yet, very few people are.

This is quite understandable: as digital channels multiply, people have to contend with app analytics, page analytics, social media analytics, tag managers, campaign tracking, etc. In short, things become very complicated, very quickly.

To ensure that you can answer your most pressing questions, I architect and implement your analytics infrastructure, create dashboards and reports and provide instructions on how to properly tag and track your camapigns.

WHAT YOU GET

Digital analytics architecture
Document the structure and configuration of the analytics tools used to track user behavior
Campaign tracking guide
Guide with guidelines on how to tag campaigns, what to watch out for, etc
Dashboards and automated reports
Dashboards and reports automatically delivered to your team on a daily, weekly or monthly basis
